content.description: All bolts are for protection. Typical of the other routes on the wall, the route has thin crimps on vertical climbing.
content.location: This the 2nd to last route on the right side of the wall.

content.description:
Start up the juggy slab of

The Crystal Ship

climbing slightly left where that climb cuts right. Devious sidepull/gaston moves deposit you at a quick shake before the upper balancy crux. This shares anchors with

The Crystal Ship

.

It is not as good as some of the other routes in the area but certainly worth it if you've climbed everything else.
content.location:
It is just left of

The Crystal Ship

.

content.description: This is the leftmost route on the wall. Climb up a lefthanded, sidepull rib until you can cut right through a weakness of crimpy edges leading to a juggy finish.
Feline Grace Abandoned is another great Tiger Wall route.
content.location: It is the 9th bolt line to the right.

content.description: This is short, thin, and technical.
content.location:
It is just to the right of

Feline Grace

.

content.description: "Pull" your way up desperate sloping holds to cruxy section involving a poor right hand, undercling pinch and sloping crimp edges.
content.location:
To the left of

Crystal Ship

, after Statement in You.

content.description: Scott Borden and I bolted this route a couple years ago while both of our two year old sons played at the base of the wall. Climb up the steep slab to the second bolt. The angle steepens, and the holds get bad. Climb up the crack like feature using small feet and powerful sidepulls passing one bolt. Clip the last bolt, and launch into the crux probably a V7 boulder problem. This has great climbing with a nice clean fall at the crux. If you are looking for something hard to try at the Tiger Wall, get on this rig!
content.protection: 4 bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location:
It is two bolt lines right of

Crystal Ship

. Follow a right-angling crack/groove feature up a black streak.

content.description: This is the 2nd route from the left side.
content.location: It is on the Tiger Wall.

content.description: This is a technical line through the slabby face.
content.location: It is in the center of the Tiger Wall and is a right variation of the line.

content.description: Cat Daddy Wu-Wu is the rightmost route on the wall and was bolted May of 2009. It now has 5 bolts.
content.location: This is the rightmost route on the Tiger Wall.

content.description: This has tricky moves on the steep, upper section.
content.location: This is to the right of "Crystal Staircase" on the blunt arete.  Start with a bouldering move to a bolt in a dished out stance.  It is not in the guidebook.
